data.title: A Complete List of Portland ZIP Codes and Map
data.meta_description: Portland is a colorful and scenic port city located in the Pacific Northwest in the U.S. State of Oregon. It is known for its vibrant art scene and stunning
data.text:
Portland is a colorful and scenic port city located in the Pacific Northwest in the U.S. State of Oregon. It is known for its vibrant art scene and stunning mountaintops and forests.

With a city population of 652,503, it is the largest city in Oregon and the 26th largest in the country.

The city was founded in 1845 and incorporated in 1851. It has a total city area of 145.00 sq mi or 375.55 sq km.

As part of the northwestern area of Oregon, Portland uses Area Codes 503 and 971 under the North American Numbering Plan (NANP).

In total, Portland has 61 ZIP Codes starting from 97086 to 97299. If you’re planning to move to Portland, some factors worth considering are the ZIP Code population and housing prices.

Fortunately, this quick guide has summarized all information you need to know in a simple table.

Continue reading to learn about each ZIP Code’s address, Area Code, population, and many more.

On top of that, this guide also shows the most populated ZIP Codes and ZIP Codes with the highest median home value for quick reference.

Portland ZIP Code Map

Click to enlarge the zip code map.

Source

View the Metropolitan Portland Area ZIP Code Boundaries Map or simply download the PDF file to check the ZIP Codes in Portland.

The map is color-coded in order to decipher the Standard, Post Office, and Unique ZIP Codes.

Moreover, you can also see the type of roads and streets with the map’s variety of road lines and shades.

If you’d like to check the ZIP Code of an address or street, use the Look Up a ZIP Code™ tool provided by the United States Postal Service (USPS).

You can also search by typing the city and state and the results page lists all available ZIP Codes.

If you already know the ZIP Code, you can find the city coverage by typing the ZIP Code under Find Cities by ZIP.

Portland ZIP Code

The table below details the location of each ZIP Code, areas covered, and type. Standard ZIP Codes are usually populated, whereas P.O. Boxes and Unique ZIP Codes normally have no recorded residents.

Refer to the table below to learn about the population density (people per sq mi), median home value, and median household income.

The most populated ZIP Code is 97229 in Bethany. It is an unincorporated community and census-designated place located in Washington County.

97229 also includes a part of the suburb Cedar Mill, another census-designated place and an unincorporated community.

Table of the Most Populated Portland ZIP Code

Scott-Arleta, Outer Southeast, Southeast Uplift 47,596 97223 Tigard 46,699 97230 Wilkes, East Portland 39,752 97233 Centennial, East Portland 39,367 97202 Westmoreland, Sellwood-Moreland, Inner Southeast, Southeast Uplift 38,762 97219 Marshall Park, Southwest 38,709 97236 Pleasant Valley, Outer Southeast, Southeast Uplift 36,852 97222 Milwaukie, Lake Road, Hecto Campbell, Linwood, Ardenwald 34,979 97266 Lents, Outer Southeast, Southeast Uplift 33,300

The ZIP Code 97210 in Forest Park, West has the highest median home value at $581,600.

The ZIP Code covers Northwest Portland, a wealthy Northwest District filled with sophisticated stores and fine-dining restaurants.

97210 is followed by 97201 with $550,300, 97212 with $460,500, and 97232 with $445,500.

Table of the Highest Median Home Value Portland ZIP Code

ZIP Code Address Median Home Value 97210 Forest Park, West $581,600 97201 Southwest Hills, Northwest, West $550,300 97212 Alameda, Irvington, Northeast $460,500 97232 Kerns, Inner Southeast, Southeast Uplift $445,500 97231 Holbrook, Burlington, Folkenberg, Miller, Harborton, Linnton $432,700 97221 Southwest Hills, Northwest, West $432,300 97239 Hillsdale, South Portland $432,300 97229 Bethany, Northwest, Rock Creek $405,300 97225 West Slope, West Haven – Sylvan, Raleigh Hills $398,600 97205 Goose Hollow $393,400

Final Thoughts

What do you think about Portland ZIP Codes? If you have further information about the ZIP Codes, please post it in the comments section below. Thank you for reading this guide and don’t hesitate to share it.
